intro: Andryala coronopifolia, commonly known as the crownleaf. It is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States, particularly in the Appalachian region. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Andryala coronopifolia is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
